title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: CI/CD Strategy: avoid incompatibilities Nix, Quarto, bslib CI, speed builds, vignettes rendered locally via targets committed git. Edit .qmd source. Run targets::tar_make() locally (Nix shell). Commit generated inst/doc/*.html files. Push GitHub. CI Behavior: CI workflow (pkgdown.yml) uses pre-built HTML files run Quarto targets.

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: ALWAYS use Quarto (.qmd) files vignettes preference RMarkdown (.Rmd). Ensure YAML header output format appropriate (e.g., rmarkdown::html_vignette quarto::html_document depending package setup).

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Minimize R Code Vignettes: Vignettes contain minimal R code. Use targets: data processing, analysis, visualization generation must done within targets pipeline. Loading Results: Vignettes primarily consist text calls targets::tar_read() targets::tar_load() display pre-computed objects (tables, plots, values). Rationale: ensures reproducibility keeps documentation clean focused narrative.

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Location: Store targets pipeline plans R/tar_plans/. Organization: distinct analysis vignette plan file (e.g., R/tar_plans/plan_memorial_analysis.R). Main _targets.R: root _targets.R file source plan files combine .

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Cachix (Preferred): project uses cachix/install-nix-action cachix-action pull binaries rstats--nix johngavin. proven faster (3-4 mins) magic-nix-cache (26+ mins due upload overhead) specific R environment. Magic Nix Cache (Avoid): use magic-nix-cache-action unless cache upload time acceptable binary cache insufficient. R-CMD-check: Run Nix (nix-shell) guarantee reproducibility consistent system dependencies. pkgdown: Run Native R (r-lib/actions) bypass Nix read-limitations Quarto/bslib. Use remotes::install_local handle local packages robustly.

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Prioritization: ensure fastest binary cache search, rstats--nix MUST prioritized project-specific cache (johngavin). Configuration Rule: Set name: rstats--nix extraPullNames: johngavin (project cache) cachix-action. Example YAML: yaml     - name: Setup Cachix       uses: cachix/cachix-action@v15       :         name: rstats--nix          # Primary cache (checked first)         extraPullNames: johngavin    # Secondary cache (checked next)         authToken: '${{ secrets.CACHIX_AUTH_TOKEN }}'

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: tidying towards end session, consider reducing number ‚Äô.md‚Äô files ./R/setup/ merging files merging duplicated topics produce fewer detailed md files. Summarise themes, topics contents similarity, suggest parts might better migrated wiki page topic theme GH repo FAQs wiki page raise GH issue outstanding issues/todo/features.  Wiki FAQs: Create maintain ‚ÄúFAQs‚Äù page GitHub Wiki documenting tasks logged ./R/setup/. entry summarize task provide direct link corresponding R script repository (e.g., link R/setup/task_name.R task_name). * README Maintenance: top-level README.md generated inst/qmd/README.qmd. content updates made .qmd file rendered README.md using Quarto (e.g., quarto render inst/qmd/README.qmd --gfm --output README.md).

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Use gert git operations (commit, push, branch, etc.). Use gh GitHub API interactions (issues, PRs, releases). Use usethis project setup workflow automation (PR helpers). Log Operations: Git/GitHub operations performed via R packages MUST logged reproducible R scripts within R/setup/ directory (e.g., R/setup/create_pr_feature_x.R). ensures workflow documented can audited reproduced.

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Post-Merge Check: merging PR, monitor pkgdown workflow main branch. Verification Loop: Check website URL (e.g., https://username.github.io/repo/) every minute (timeout 5 mins) confirm update deployed successfully.

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Upon DESCRIPTION Update: Whenever DESCRIPTION file updated (e.g., adding new Imports Suggests), MUST immediately verify listed packages available current Nix shell environment. Verification Command: Run following command attempt loading dependencies: bash     Rscript -e 'd <- read.dcf("DESCRIPTION"); pkgs <- unique(trimws(unlist(strsplit(c(("Imports" %% colnames(d)) d[,"Imports"] else NULL, ("Suggests" %% colnames(d)) d[,"Suggests"] else NULL, ("Depends" %% colnames(d)) d[,"Depends"] else NULL), ",")))); pkgs <- gsub("\s*\(.*\)", "", pkgs); pkgs <- pkgs[pkgs != "R"]; missing <- pkgs[!sapply(pkgs, function(p) requireNamespace(p, quietly = TRUE))]; (length(missing) > 0) { cat("Missing packages:", paste(missing, collapse = ", "), "\n"); quit(status = 1) } else { cat("dependencies available.\n") }' Action Failure: verification fails (packages missing), proceed implementation. Instead, ask user advice update Nix environment (e.g., updating default.R regenerating default.nix).

title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Fixed Versions: defining Nix environment (e.g., default.R via rix), NEVER use dynamic version specifiers like "latest-upstream". Always use fixed date (e.g., "2025-11-25") specific commit hash. ensures environment remains identical time, preventing future breakages due package updates.

what: 9. Reproducible R Session Management: Persistent Nix Shell Requirement
title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Effective Date: 2025-11-11 primary objective R development workflows within Nix/rix environments true reproducibility. achieved enforcing use single persistent nix-shell executing R commands across projects.

previous_headings: 9. Reproducible R Session Management: Persistent Nix Shell Requirement
what: 9.1 Starting and Using the Persistent Nix Shell
title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Always verify nix shell. necessary commands R packages available. Running R scripts (Rscript). Interactive R sessions (R). Package development commands (devtools::check(), devtools::test(), devtools::document()). Website building (pkgdown::build_site()). Git/GitHub operations using R packages (gert, gh, usethis). targets pipeline execution. R-related operations.

previous_headings: 9. Reproducible R Session Management: Persistent Nix Shell Requirement
title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: Adhering principle ensures: * Consistent Package Versions: operations benefit single, consistent set package versions defined Nix environment. * Shared R Session State: Enables continuity work shared objects/data within R session. * Faster Execution: Avoids repeated, time-consuming initialization new Nix environments individual commands. * True Reproducibility: Guarantees environment remains identical throughout session, fundamental reproducible research development. * Avoids Pitfalls: New shell instances break reproducibility, may different state slightly different package configurations.

previous_headings: 9. Reproducible R Session Management: Persistent Nix Shell Requirement
title: AGENTS.md - Agent Guidelines for this Project
text: ‚ùå WRONG Approach (): Launching new nix-shell instances individual commands breaks reproducibility. bash     # Creates new environment time - breaks reproducibility     nix-shell --run "Rscript script1.R"     nix-shell --run "Rscript script2.R"     nix-shell --run "Rscript script3.R" ‚úÖ CORRECT Approach (Always ): Execute commands within single persistent shell. bash     # execute commands shell:     Rscript script1.R     Rscript script2.R     Rscript script3.R

code: # Edit R code, vignettes, documentation, etc. vim R/my_function.R vim vignettes/memorial-analysis.qmd

text: : - Fetch data (needed) - Run analysis - Render vignettes inst/doc/*.html (794KB) - Build pkgdown site docs/ Fix errors warnings proceeding!

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
code: library(gert)  # Stage all changes git_add(c(   "R/",                           # Your code changes   "vignettes/",                   # Vignette source   "inst/doc/*.html",              # Pre-built vignettes (REQUIRED)   "man/",                         # Documentation   "NAMESPACE"                     # If changed ))  git_commit("Update analysis: description of changes")

what: Step 5: Push to Trigger Fast CI
title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: CI : - Run 1-2 minutes (20 minutes!) - Use pre-built vignettes inst/doc/ - Build pkgdown site - Deploy GitHub Pages targets, Quarto, data fetching CI

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: Quarto + bslib + Nix = incompatible CI Data fetching + rendering = 20+ minutes per push exhaust GitHub Actions quota quickly

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: Build vignettes locally (Nix works fine locally) Commit pre-built HTML git CI just builds website (fast)

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: ‚úÖ Pros: - Fast CI (1-2 mins vs 20+ mins) - bslib/Nix compatibility issues - Saves GitHub Actions quota - Reproducible (Nix locally, targets manages dependencies) ‚ö†Ô∏è Cons: - Must run targets locally push (REQUIRED step) - Pre-built HTML git (~794KB per vignette) - Must remember commit inst/doc/*.html

what: ‚ùå WRONG: Push without running targets locally
title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: Problem: Vignette shows old results, website outdated
code: vim R/my_function.R git add R/ git commit -m "Update function" git push  # ‚Üê WRONG! Vignette is now stale!

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
code: vim R/my_function.R Rscript -e 'targets::tar_make()'  # ‚Üê Rebuilds vignette git add R/ inst/doc/ git commit -m "Update function and vignette" git push  # ‚Üê Good! Everything is up-to-date

what: ‚ùå WRONG: Forget to commit pre-built vignettes
title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
text: Problem: CI won‚Äôt find pre-built vignettes
code: Rscript -e 'targets::tar_make()' git add R/ vignettes/  # ‚Üê Missing inst/doc/! git commit -m "Update" git push

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
code: Rscript -e 'targets::tar_make()' git add R/ vignettes/ inst/doc/*.html  # ‚Üê Include pre-built HTML git commit -m "Update" git push

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
code: # Check if they exist ls -lh inst/doc/  # If missing, run targets Rscript -e 'targets::tar_make()'  # Commit them git add inst/doc/*.html git commit --amend --no-edit git push --force-with-lease

title: Developer Workflow - Pre-built Vignettes Strategy
code: # Force rebuild Rscript -e 'targets::tar_destroy()' Rscript -e 'targets::tar_make()'  # Commit updated vignette git add inst/doc/*.html git commit -m "Update vignette with latest data" git push

what: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
title: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
text: londonremembers R package provides robust, transparent, reproducible framework acquiring, analyzing, interactively mapping public statues memorials London. Moving beyond single data source, package integrates information multiple authoritative APIs (Wikidata, OpenStreetMap, Greater London Historic Environment Record) create comprehensive, deduplicated dataset. core purpose enable -depth analysis London‚Äôs commemorative landscape, facilitate validation public claims (e.g., regarding gender representation), offer interactive data exploration. England‚Äôs grand capital, dear, Johns dames, appears. woman might, John‚Äôs plain sight, Confirming gendered-statue fears.

title: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
text: package leverages robust multi-source data acquisition strategy build comprehensive dataset London‚Äôs statues memorials. approach ensures broader coverage, higher data quality, improved reproducibility compared single-source methods. Primary Data Sources: Wikidata: Structured linked open data, queried via SPARQL endpoint. Provides rich metadata subjects, creators, precise geographic coordinates. OpenStreetMap (OSM): Community-contributed geographic data, accessed via Overpass API. Excellent detailed location information various memorial tags. Greater London Historic Environment Record (GLHER): Professional heritage data, accessed via CSV exports. Offers authoritative records high data quality. Note londonremembers.com: initially source interest, direct programmatic access (e.g., web scraping) londonremembers.com proved unfeasible due JavaScript-rendered content lack public API. project thus pivots API-driven sources ensure reliability reproducibility. multi-source strategy allows spatial deduplication intelligent merging records, creating unified enriched dataset analysis.

title: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
text: can install development version GitHub: Note Nix Environment: project developed within Nix environment ensure full reproducibility consistent package management. highly recommended use provided Nix configuration (default.nix) set development environment. ensure necessary R packages (e.g., WikidataQueryServiceR, osmdata, sf, leaflet) system dependencies correctly installed. Refer default.nix QUICK_START_GUIDE.md details setting using Nix shell.

title: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
text: londonremembers package offers comprehensive suite functionalities exploring London‚Äôs commemorative landscape: Multi-Source Data Retrieval: Seamlessly acquire statue memorial data Wikidata, OpenStreetMap, GLHER APIs. Data Standardization & Deduplication: Standardize diverse data formats common schema intelligently deduplicate records based geographic proximity using spatial algorithms. Interactive Mapping: Generate rich interactive Leaflet maps displaying statue locations detailed pop-ups (name, subject, year, material, sculptor, image, source links) marker clustering optimal visualization. Gender Analysis: Analyze representation genders among commemorated subjects, enabling critical validation public claims (e.g., ‚Äústatues men named John women‚Äù). Reproducible Workflow: Built reproducibility mind, leveraging caching, targets pipelines, transparent methodology.

title: Access and Analyze London Memorials Data
text: londonremembers package simplifies process acquiring, processing, analyzing statue data. basic examples get started. comprehensive guide, refer project vignette.
code: library(londonremembers) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(leaflet) # For viewing the map  # 1. Retrieve data from multiple sources (with caching) #    These functions query the respective APIs wikidata_data <- get_statues_wikidata(location = "Q84", cache_path = "data-raw/wikidata_cache.rds") osm_data <- get_statues_osm(bbox = c(-0.510375, 51.28676, 0.334015, 51.691874), cache_path = "data-raw/osm_cache.rds") glher_data <- get_statues_glher(cache_path = "data-raw/glher_cache.rds")  # 2. Standardize data to a common schema wikidata_std <- standardize_statue_data(wikidata_data, "wikidata") osm_std <- standardize_statue_data(osm_data, "osm") glher_std <- standardize_statue_data(glher_data, "glher")  # 3. Combine and deduplicate the data all_statues <- combine_statue_sources(   list(wikidata = wikidata_std, osm = osm_std, glher = glher_std),   distance_threshold = 50 # meters )  message("Total unique statues identified: ", nrow(all_statues)) # Example: Total unique statues identified: 250  # 4. Perform gender analysis gender_results <- analyze_by_gender(all_statues) print(gender_results$summary) # Example output: #   inferred_gender     n percent # 1            Male   180    72.0 # 2          Female    50    20.0 # 3         Unknown    15     6.0 # 4          Animal     5     2.0  # 5. Validate claims (e.g., "more Johns than women") johns_vs_women <- compare_johns_vs_women(all_statues) message(johns_vs_women$message) # Example: Found 20 statues named John (8.0%) vs 50 women statues (20.0%). message("Claim 'more Johns than women' validated (False if Johns <= Women): ", johns_vs_women$claim_validated) # Example: Claim 'more Johns than women' validated (False if Johns <= Women): FALSE  # 6. Create an interactive map statue_map <- map_statues(   all_statues,   popup_fields = c("name", "subject", "year_installed", "material"),   color_by = "source",   cluster = TRUE ) statue_map # Display the map in RStudio Viewer or browser # htmlwidgets::saveWidget(statue_map, "london_statues_map.html") # To save to HTML file

title: Combine and Deduplicate Statue Data from Multiple Sources ‚Äî combine_statue_sources
Combine and Deduplicate Statue Data from Multiple Sources ‚Äî combine_statue_sources
text: source_list Named list standardized data frames, e.g. list(wikidata = wd_data, osm = osm_data, glher = glher_data) distance_threshold Distance meters considering records duplicates (default: 50) prefer_sources Vector source names order preference resolving conflicts (default: c("glher", "wikidata", "osm", ""))

title: Combine and Deduplicate Statue Data from Multiple Sources ‚Äî combine_statue_sources
text: tibble combined, deduplicated statue data, additional   columns:   - sources: character - comma-separated list contributing sources   - n_sources: integer - number sources contributing data   - is_multi_source: logical - TRUE data multiple sources   - duplicate_ids: character - IDs duplicate records merged

what: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
text: Downloads CSV data Greater London Historic Environment Record (GLHER) monuments tagged statues person memorials.

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
code: get_statues_glher(   query_terms = c("person", "statue"),   resource_type = "Monument",   max_results = 500,   cache_path = NULL )

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
text: query_terms Search terms (default: c("person", "statue")) resource_type Resource type filter (default: "Monument") max_results Maximum results retrieve (default: 500) cache_path Path cache results (default: NULL)

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
text: tibble columns: glher_id, name, description, type,   lat, lon, period, url

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
text: GLHER provides professional heritage data high quality metadata precise coordinates. CSV export accessed via URL parameters.

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Greater London HER ‚Äî get_statues_glher
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get person statues from GLHER glher_statues <- get_statues_glher()  # Get all monument types glher_monuments <- get_statues_glher(   query_terms = NULL,   max_results = 1000 ) } # }

what: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
title: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
text: Queries OpenStreetMap Overpass API statues memorials using multiple OSM tags maximize coverage.

title: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
code: get_statues_osm(   bbox = c(-0.510375, 51.28676, 0.334015, 51.691874),   tags = list(list(key = "memorial", value = "statue"), list(key = "historic", value =     "memorial"), list(key = "man_made", value = "statue")),   cache_path = NULL )

title: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
text: bbox Bounding box (min_lon, min_lat, max_lon, max_lat). Default Greater London. tags OSM tags query. Default includes memorial=statue, historic=memorial, man_made=statue cache_path Path cache results (default: NULL)

title: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
text: tibble columns: osm_id, osm_type, name, subject, lat, lon,   memorial_type, historic_type, tags_list

title: Retrieve Statue Data from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî get_statues_osm
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get all London statues from OSM london_statues_osm <- get_statues_osm()  # Custom bounding box (Westminster) westminster_bbox <- c(-0.1773, 51.4899, -0.1131, 51.5155) westminster_statues <- get_statues_osm(bbox = westminster_bbox) } # }

text: location Wikidata ID location (default: "Q84" London) limit Maximum number results (default: 1000) cache_path Path cache results (default: NULL caching)

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Wikidata ‚Äî get_statues_wikidata
text: tibble columns: wikidata_id, name, subject, lat, lon,   inception_date, material, creator, image_url, wikipedia_url

title: Retrieve Statue Data from Wikidata ‚Äî get_statues_wikidata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get all London statues from Wikidata london_statues <- get_statues_wikidata(location = "Q84")  # Get statues with caching london_statues <- get_statues_wikidata(   location = "Q84",   cache_path = "data-raw/wikidata_cache.rds" ) } # }

what: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
title: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
text: Creates interactive Leaflet map showing statue locations rich popup information appears hover click.

title: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
code: map_statues(   statue_data,   popup_fields = c("name", "subject", "year_installed", "material", "sculptor",     "source_url"),   color_by = "source",   cluster = TRUE,   tiles = "OpenStreetMap" )

title: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
text: statue_data tibble statue data (standardized format) popup_fields Vector column names include popup color_by Column name use color coding (default: "source") cluster Whether use marker clustering (default: TRUE) tiles Map tile provider (default: "OpenStreetMap")

title: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
text: leaflet map object

title: Create Interactive Map of Statues with Popup Information ‚Äî map_statues
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get and combine data all_statues <- get_all_statue_data()  # Create interactive map map <- map_statues(all_statues) map  # Display in viewer/browser  # Customize popup fields map2 <- map_statues(   all_statues,   popup_fields = c("name", "subject", "year_installed", "material"),   color_by = "type" )  # Save to HTML htmlwidgets::saveWidget(map2, "london_statues_map.html") } # }

what: Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
title: Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
text: Converts statue data source standardized schema consistent column names, data types, structure.

title: Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
text: data tibble source (wikidata, osm, glher, etc.) source Source identifier ("wikidata", "osm", "glher", "")

title: Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
text: tibble standardized schema:   - id: character - unique identifier (source_originalid)   - name: character - statue/memorial name   - subject: character - /commemorated   - subject_gender: character - gender (determinable)   - lat: numeric - latitude (WGS84)   - lon: numeric - longitude (WGS84)   - location: character - human-readable location   - type: character - statue, memorial, plaque, etc.   - material: character - bronze, stone, etc.   - year_installed: integer - year installation/inception   - sculptor: character - creator name   - description: character - full description   - image_url: character - URL image   - source: character - data source   - source_url: character - link source record   - last_updated: Date - data retrieved

title: Standardize Statue Data to Common Schema ‚Äî standardize_statue_data
